title: KHS - Korean temples
description: KOREA HERITAGE SERVICE [KHS] digitized Korea's traditional temple buildings.
longDescription:
KOREA HERITAGE SERVICE [KHS]


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple Buljojeon Hall is a Buddhist temple built during the Joseon Dynasty in Seonamsa Temple, Jukhak-ri, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do, with 3 bays in front and 3 bays in side. It is a three-room Ikgonggye Paljakjip in front, and it is a building in the late Joseon Dynasty that shows the date of construction.


Wontongjeon Hall of Seonamsa Temple in Suncheon is a temple building that was renovated in the late Joseon Dynasty in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Iljumun is a Iljumun in Jukhak-ri, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple's reconstruction/private monument is a historic monument related to the reconstruction of Seonamsa Temple in the late Joseon Dynasty in Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple Palsangjeon Hall is a temple during the Three Kingdoms period in the eastern foot of Jogyesan Mountain, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple is a toilet located in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Gakhwangjeon Hall of Seonamsa Temple in Suncheon is a building located in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple's Maae Standing Buddha is a statue carved on a rock in the middle from Seonamsa Temple to Daegakam Hermitage, located in Jukhak-ri, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Samindang Pond of Seonamsa Temple in Suncheon is an oval pond of unified Silla during the period of the North and South Korea, located in Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Daeungjeon Hall is a Daeungjeon Hall of the Joseon Dynasty in Seonamsa Temple, Jukhak-ri, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple Dong Seungtap Pagoda is a tower of the Goryeo Dynasty located in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


Suncheon Seonamsa Temple Bukseung Pagoda is a Goryeo-era pagoda located in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.

 

The Daegakam Leaning Tower of Seonamsa Temple in Suncheon is a pagoda of the Goryeo Dynasty in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do.


The three-story stone pagoda in Suncheon Seonamsa Temple is located in Seonamsa Temple, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do, and is a two stone pagoda built during the period of unified Silla during the period of the North and South Korea.


Suncheon Seonamsa Seoncheon Bridge is a stone bridge located in Seonamsa Temple, Jukhak-ri, Seungju-eup, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do. It was designated as a treasure on September 2, 1963.


The bell tower of Songgwangsa Temple in Wanju is a pavilion of the Joseon Dynasty located in Songgwangsa Temple in Wanju County, North Jeolla Province. A treasure.


Daejeokgwangjeon Hall of Girimsa Temple in Gyeongju is a temple building that was rebuilt in the late Joseon Dynasty in Munmuwang-myeon, Gyeongju-si, Gyeongsangbuk-do. A treasure.


Daeungjeon Hall of Ssanggyesa Temple in Nonsan is a temple building built during the Joseon Dynasty in Ssanggyesa Temple in Yangchon-myeon, Nonsan-si, Chungcheongnam-do. A treasure.


Mireukjeon Hall of Geumsan Temple in Gimje is a three-story Buddhist hall built on the right side of Daejeokgwangjeon Hall in the precincts of Geumsan Temple, with five bays in front and four bays in side space on the first and second floors, and three bays in front and two bays in side space on the third floor.
technicalDetails:
Collision: Yes

Number of vertices: 1,552,433

LOD: No

Number of Unique Meshes: 207

Number of Materials and Material Instances: 211

Number of Textures: 846

Texture Resolution: 512*512, 1024*1024, 2048*2048, 4096*4096

Supported Development Platforms:

Windows: Yes

Mac: No


This product supports Lumen for Unreal Engine 5.0+
